timeline.bodyText:
Any  particular reason to use the collector?
It's possible to convert a Stream using Multi and return a Uni<Void> by using ignore().
It would look something like:
return getEntityManager.flatMap( em -> 
    Multi.createFrom().items( entities )
        .onItem().invoke( entity -> em.persist( entity ) )
        .onItem().ignoreAsUni()
);

replies.bodyText:
Alternatively, we should consider simply not supporting hints at all in Panache. They're really there only to allow use of vendor-specific features via the JPA-standard APIs, but they're untypesafe and inconvenient.
I would argue that it would be better if Panache offered typesafe APIs for Hibernate-specific features. As far as I understand, support for other JPA implementations is a non-goal.

replies.bodyText:
I'd love to fully eradicate support for hints from ORM, and have a proper API instead.
Of course we can't because of specs, but we could introduce an internal configurtion setting to at least ignore them for Hibernate Reactive (and maybe even for ORM classic when within Quarkus).
Beyond API benefits of more explicit options, dealing with them is also highl inefficient.

replies.bodyText:
I don't mind if we replace hint support if you tell me HR will not support them.

Yeah but I'm advocating removing them from the regular (non-reactive) API as well. Or rather, representing the specific hints that Hibernate supports in a type safe way, just like what I've done in certain specific cases in the HR API.
